data.title: William Hine-Haycock (bef.1831-1903)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Compare DNA and explore genealogy for William Hine-Haycock born bef. 1831 Shrewsbury, Shropshire, England, United Kingdom died 1903 Chelsea, Middlesex, England including ancestors + children + DNA connections + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Ancestors

[spouse(s) unknown]

Profile last modified 22 Jun 2023 | Created 31 Aug 2018

This page has been accessed 166 times.

Biography

Start of the Hine-Haycock branch

William was born in Shrewsbury, Shropshire, England in 1831. He was the son of Edward Haycock and Mary Hatton Hincksman. He came from a family of architects, but William seems to have found an occupation as a solicitor.

He married Anne Marie Parker in Maidstone, Kent in 1859.[1] They had possibly 6 children.

Ralph Hine Haycock 1860–Deceased • m. Margaret Parker

Trevitt Reginald Hine Haycock 1862–Deceased • m. Grace J Thornton

Reginald Haycock 1864–Deceased • absent 1871 and 1881 censuses

Adelaide Mary Trevar Hine Haycock 1867–Deceased • d. unmarried

Archibald Leslie Hine Haycock 1870–Deceased • m. Alexa Maud Petherick

Vaughan Randolph Hine Haycock 1871–1937 • m. Grace Mary Vaughan- Arbuckle

They lived in Little Heath, Charlton-by-Sunbury, London.[2][3]

By 1881 the family lived in Sidmouth, Devon. William is described as a solicitor not in active practice. The family were well to do, with 5 servants.[4]

In 1901 he and his wife were living in Church Street, Chelsea with unmarried daughter Adelaide. They still had enough wealth to live comfortably and employ 3 servants, without any income.[5]

He passed away in 1903, probably in Chelsea,[6] and is buried in West Brompton Cemetery, Kensington & Chelsea. His widow passed away in 1911 and is buried in the same place.

Find A Grave: Memorial #222087548

Sources

↑ "British Newspaper Archive, Family Notices," database with images, FamilySearch (https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:QLSW-2WK7 : 18 April 2019), William Hine Haycock, Maidstone, Kent, England, United Kingdom; records extracted FamilySearch and images digitized by FindMyPast; citing Maidstone, Kent, England, United Kingdom, 7 May 1859, The British Newspaper Archive, Ireland; FHL microfilm .

↑ Birth records for Adelaide 1867, Archibald 1870 and Vaughan 1871 give same location, confirmed by 1871 census (residence) and 1881 census (birth locations)

↑ "England and Wales Census, 1871", database with images, FamilySearch (https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:VB67-QJY : 25 June 2022), William Hine Haycock, 1871.

↑ "England and Wales Census, 1881," database with images, FamilySearch (https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:Q276-G8BV : 12 December 2017), William Hine Haycock, Sidmouth, Devon, England; from "1881 England, Scotland and Wales Census," database and images, findmypast (http://www.findmypast.com : n.d.); citing p. 9, Piece/Folio 2136/8, The National Archives, Kew, Surrey; FHL microfilm 101,774,762.

↑ "England and Wales Census, 1901," database, FamilySearch (https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:X942-RVX : 20 May 2019), William Hine-Haycock, Chelsea, London, England, United Kingdom; from "1901 England, Scotland and Wales census," database and images, findmypast (http://www.findmypast.com : n.d.); citing Chelsea North subdistrict, PRO RG 13, The National Archives, Kew, Surrey.

↑ "England and Wales Death Registration Index 1837-2007," database, FamilySearch (https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:2N5F-D1Z : 31 December 2014), William Hine Haycock, 1903; from "England & Wales Deaths, 1837-2006," database, findmypast (http://www.findmypast.com : 2012); citing Death, Chelsea, London, England, General Register Office, Southport, England.

from family history work done by William Hine-Haycock, Kittery Quay, Kingswear - 1989

additional sourcing from https://www.familysearch.org/tree/person/details/L1PJ-GSP

Research Notes

Was he born Hine-Haycock (his siblings all seem to just be Haycock) or did he adopt it at some point later in life? The only record on which it is hyphenated is the 1901 census, although it should be noted his wife had adopted it and all his children bore it, albeit unhyphenated, in the 1881 census whereas in the 1871 census it only appeared once as William's middle name. Theory: some time between 1871 and 1881 William made a legal application to change his surname and that of his family from Haycock to Hine-Haycock.
